symc.name: TPM_CENTERALIGN
symc.desc: Centers the shortcut menu horizontally relative to the coordinate specified by the x parameter.

symc.name: TPM_LEFTALIGN
symc.desc: Positions the shortcut menu so that its left side is aligned with the coordinate specified by the x parameter.

symc.name: TPM_RIGHTALIGN
symc.desc: Positions the shortcut menu so that its right side is aligned with the coordinate specified by the x parameter.

symc.name: TPM_BOTTOMALIGN
symc.desc: Positions the shortcut menu so that its bottom side is aligned with the coordinate specified by the y parameter.

symc.name: TPM_TOPALIGN
symc.desc: Positions the shortcut menu so that its top side is aligned with the coordinate specified by the y parameter.

symc.name: TPM_VCENTERALIGN
symc.desc: Centers the shortcut menu vertically relative to the coordinate specified by the y parameter.

symc.name: TPM_NONOTIFY
symc.desc: The function does not send notification messages when the user clicks a menu item.

symc.name: TPM_LEFTBUTTON
symc.desc: The user can select menu items with only the left mouse button.

symc.name: TPM_RIGHTBUTTON
symc.desc: The user can select menu items with both the left and right mouse buttons.

symc.name: TPM_HORNEGANIMATION
symc.desc: Animates the menu from right to left.

symc.name: TPM_HORPOSANIMATION
symc.desc: Animates the menu from left to right.

symc.name: TPM_VERNEGANIMATION
symc.desc: Animates the menu from bottom to top.

symc.name: TPM_VERPOSANIMATION
symc.desc:
Animates the menu from top to bottom.
For any animation to occur, the SystemParametersInfo function must set SPI_SETMENUANIMATION. Also, all the TPM_*ANIMATION flags, except TPM_NOANIMATION, are ignored if menu fade animation is on. For more information, see the SPI_GETMENUFADE flag in SystemParametersInfo. Use the TPM_RECURSE flag to display a menu when another menu is already displayed. This is intended to support context menus within a menu.

symc.name: TPM_HORIZONTAL
symc.desc: If the menu cannot be shown at the specified location without overlapping the excluded rectangle, the system tries to accommodate the requested horizontal alignment before the requested vertical alignment.

symc.name: TPM_VERTICAL
symc.desc:
If the menu cannot be shown at the specified location without overlapping the excluded rectangle, the system tries to accommodate the requested vertical alignment before the requested horizontal alignment.
The excluded rectangle is a portion of the screen that the menu should not overlap; it is specified by the lptpm parameter. For right-to-left text layout, use TPM_LAYOUTRTL. By default, the text layout is left-to-right.
